page.title: 09Redcar as a holiday resort
page.content:
50 years ago Redcar was popular with Yorkshire people for their holidays as they could not afford to go far away for a holiday.
After 1945 Redcar became a dormitory town for industrial Middlesbrough but the people of Redcar wanted a quiet town and didn't want too many holiday makers coming to Redcar. Now people are returning, particularly the day-trippers.
For holiday makers today there is the R.N.L.I.Zetland Lifeboat Museum, miles of sandy beaches, rocks, Redcar Races, a Leisure Centre, an annual Carnival and an annual Folk Festival.
There are two caravan sites and plenty of Bed and Breakfast accommodation.
